segments.text: What are you listening to ? Is that Beethoven or Mozart ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's Beethoven . Do you like it ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I think Beethoven's music is incredible . I've heard that listening to it can make you more intelligent , too . Do you believe that ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I don't know about that , but I do think that it helps people relax .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What other kind of music do you listen to ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Actually , I mostly just listen classical music . What about you ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: To be honest , I think classical music is too complicated for me .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What kind of music do you prefer then ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I like pop music . Do you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Not really . I don't think pop music has much depth .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see what you mean . I think that's way I like it so much .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: How long have you been in to pop music , then ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I've always been into it . Have you always liked classical music ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Not really . When I was little , we didn't really listen to music at all .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: So , how did you become interested in it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , when I was about 10 years old , I started playing the piano . I think that's how it all started .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , it's one of my hobbies .
segments.speaker: S2
